title: Stevens Cabinet Card Marty Sullivan For Sale ***SOLD***
author: Jacklitsch

posts.post_title: Stevens Cabinet Card Marty Sullivan For Sale ***SOLD***
posts.post_content:
Offered today is a Stevens Art Studio Cabinet card of Marty Sullivan. Marty played for the Chicago Baseball Club in 1887 and 1888. It is original and in great shape for its age.

Measures approx 4" by 6". Photo affixed to heavy stock mount.

Reverse shows signs of having been affixed by the four corners to an album page at one time.

Image on cabinet used for his Four Base Hit card pictured. THAT CARD IS NOT MINE AND IS NOT OFFERED.

$SOLD

email interest to [url]ahlaw555@msn.com[/url] Please no posts. No DM's as I check infrequently.

Steve, too bad that Sullivan wasn't in uniform.  But then again if he were in uniform, it'd be a heck of a lot more than the $500 asking price, which IMO is more than reasonable.  Anyone want to make a pool on how long this piece is on the BST before it sells?  I'm giving it less than a couple days.  

Nice cabinet - Should be an easy sale!
